headline: Essential Security Checks for Modern Apps

digest_items.title: Remove default credentials
digest_items.why: Default passwords are publicly known and exploited by automated scanners
digest_items.fix: Change all default passwords immediately after deployment

digest_items.title: Scan for exposed .git directories
digest_items.why: Exposed .git folders can leak source code and sensitive configuration
digest_items.fix: Block access in web server config or use .htaccess: 'RedirectMatch 404 /\.git'

digest_items.title: Use Web Application Firewall (WAF)
digest_items.why: WAF protects against common web attacks like SQL injection and XSS
digest_items.fix: Deploy CloudFlare, AWS WAF, or ModSecurity

digest_items.title: Review user access permissions
digest_items.why: Stale permissions from former employees pose security risk
digest_items.fix: Conduct quarterly access reviews and remove unnecessary permissions

digest_items.title: Use TLS 1.3 exclusively
digest_items.why: Older TLS versions have known vulnerabilities and weaker cipher suites
digest_items.fix: Update server config to disable TLS 1.0, 1.1, 1.2 and enable only TLS 1.3
